item.title: BoredomClass (a learning experience)
item.dc:creator: @MC_Gower MC Gower
item.description:
@MC_Gower wrote:

I’ll go through some bad practices in this. By using something that he excluded.

import java.io.*; //Not ever used, ever.
public class BoredomClass { //Should be Boredom, not BoredomClass. Not using naming conventions.

public static boolean bored;
public static boolean print = true; //Never used, ever.
//public static boolean checkBoredStatus() { //naming conventions: get/set, so..
public static boolean getBored() {//correct way of doing it
	//return bored ? true : false;
	return bored; //^ above logic isn't needed, simplified code works better
}
public static int boredom[] = {0, 1}; //No clue why you want to store it as ints, but ok. I'll have more to complain about.
public static int randomBoredom() { //updated with checks incase a noob uses 2 instead of 0 or 1
						//not to mention array lengths can crash a program.
	try {
		int val = boredom[(int)(Math.random()*boredom.length)];
		if(val < 2 && val > -1) return val;
	catch(Exception e){
		return -1;
	}
	return -1;
}
		public static void main (String[] args) { //Updated test for value
			int i = randomBoredom();
			if(i != -1) bored = i != 0;
			else bored = false;
			System.out.println("Boredom is "+getBored()); //Renamed method change
		}
}

Read full topic

item.title: BoredomClass (a learning experience)
item.dc:creator: @MC_Gower MC Gower
item.description:
@MC_Gower wrote:

LeScape Pk:

tried it, doesnt work. ^^

Does work.

bored = randomBoredom() != 0;

bored is a boolean, therefore the following after the = sign can be a true/false check.

if randomBoredom() returns a value that does not equal 0, it is true, else it is false.

Better than a bunch of if statements when you can get something done much faster.

Read full topic

item.title: BoredomClass (a learning experience)
item.dc:creator: @MC_Gower MC Gower
item.description:
@MC_Gower wrote:

		public static void main (String[] args) {
			if (randomBoredom() == 0) {
				bored = false;
			}
			if (randomBoredom() == 1) {
				bored = true;
			}
			System.out.println("Boredom is "+checkBoredStatus());
		}

to

		public static void main (String[] args) {
			bored = randomBoredom() != 0;
			System.out.println("Boredom is "+checkBoredStatus());
		}
